body:
This is documented, please take a look
- https://rclone.org/docs/#configuration-encryption
- https://rclone.org/docs/#password-command-spaceseplist
- https://github.com/rclone/rclone/wiki/Windows-Powershell-use-rclone-password-command-for-Config-file-password

1) Presuming one is building rclone from source
2) Presuming one uses rclone on same system and already has password protected rclone.conf in $HOME/.config/rclone/rclone.conf

It will not be possible to run any commands without being prompted for a password.
The kludge work around is to run ```rclone --config rclone.conf```.  rclone.conf need not exist, the point is to bypass loading of the password protected rclone.conf.
```
touch rclone.conf
./rclone --config rclone.conf genautocomplete bash rclone.bash_completion
./rclone --config rclone.conf genautocomplete zsh rclone.zsh_completion
```
When I package rclone for Arch, I like to generate and properly install the auto-completion files to simplify command line usage.  This method allows me to generate those files without being prompted for a password.

The "official" no-config way is simply `rclone --config /dev/null ...`
or `export RCLONE_CONFIG=/dev/null; rclone ...`

Reference: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/2879#issuecomment-450558947
Starting with 1.55 the `rclone --config=/notfound ...` and `--config=""` will become an OS independent way to disable config file reading (useful for automation).
Related to #2879 (it requests a new `--no-config` flag, but I suggest to close it)

rename.from: Using password protected rclone.conf forces password entry for any command line option
rename.to: docs: explicitly describe how to disable config reading (for automation)

body: Reopening because I cannot find this in documentation

issue.title: Implement --no-config flag

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I believe there are two ways to use rclone: 
- interactively, using config, possibly with config password
- in pure cli mode, using `--b2-account` etc. long options

Right now, if there is a config password set, it breaks pure cli mode.

With no config:
```
rclone lsd --b2-account x --b2-key y :b2:
```
works

With config, the same command breaks with `Enter configuration password:` prompt. 

If I try a workaround and specify `--ask-password=false`, it still doesn't work, terminating in 
```
unable to decrypt configuration and not allowed to ask for password - set RCLONE_CONFIG_PASS to your configuration password
```

This means, that it is not possible to develop rclone cli scripts on a dev machine with config set. 
I always have to rename the config folder before and after testing such scripts.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.45
- os/arch: darwin/amd64
- go version: go1.11.2
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
macOS 10.14.2

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Backblaze B2, but I believe it's not relevant.


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)



#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
Nothing except arg parsing.

body: as noted by @albertony, the `--config=NUL` trick works on Windows

issue.title: docs: describe how to bypass loading of config file

repository.name: rclone

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

Document how to bypass loading of config file, relevant when keeping encrypted configuration file but executing commands not relying on configuration (such as genautocomplete) - because one may want to avoid the password prompt.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

Fixes #5125
Depending on https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/bb0b6432ae5d74a741815a8cc1f0cf2d46e3dddb

- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
